summary: This is the last will and testament of Jeffrey E. Epstein, dated October 24, 2012, with a first codicil dated June 6, 2013. It appoints executors to manage his estate, directs all assets to be transferred to The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2012 Trust, and includes detailed provisions for estate administration. The codicil changes the successor executor.

events.title: Execution of Last Will and Testament
events.description: Jeffrey E. Epstein signs his last will and testament, appointing executors and directing his estate to a trust.

events.title: Execution of First Codicil
events.description: Jeffrey E. Epstein signs a first codicil to his will, changing the named successor executor from Andrew Farkas to David J. Mitchell.

locations: Little St. James Island, St. Thomas, United States Virgin Islands
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein's will directs that his entire estate, after expenses, be transferred to 'The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2012 Trust'.
The will appoints Darren K. Indyke, Joseph Pagano, and James E. Staley as co-executors, each to receive $250,000 upon completion of probate.
A first codicil, dated June 6, 2013, changes the named successor executor from Andrew Farkas to David J. Mitchell.
The will includes a 'no-contest' clause, disinheriting any beneficiary who challenges the will or the trust.
The document grants the executors extremely broad powers to manage, invest, and dispose of estate assets without needing court approval.
